intro: Grastidium meliodorum, commonly known as the sweet-scented orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), while its roots are adapted for absorbing moisture from the air. The flowers emit a sweet aroma, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
